page.title: 06EVENTS 1 P WAKLEY
page.content:
Some Events of the Village Year
Many events centre around fund-raising, either for the Church,Hall or W.I. But the custom of Tip-Tip-Toe, which may have stemmed from beating of the bounds, is carried out by the school children on Shrove Tuesday. The Fete in June, Flower Show in August and, this year, a Barn Dance in May, are great events in which all can take part. Refreshments are provided by the ladies of the village and drinks by a local pub or bought in for the occasion. This year Morris-men came and danced in the village centre. Bonfire night is celebrated with an enormous fire in a nearby field, fireworks and food.
